title: Software Development Engineer React/Angular/Golang - India Remote
description:
**Software Development Engineer (2\\+ Years Experience)** 




**Company: ThoughtData** 




**ThoughtData** 
 is a leading enterprise IT infrastructure management solutions provider, dedicated to helping global enterprises achieve
 **unified observability** 
 . Our mission is to help organizations reduce Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) by 4x, eliminate poor performance, and proactively stop IT outages with a unified
 **AIOps platform** 
 (Enterprise360\\). We are looking for bright, motivated engineers to join our team and contribute to building high\\-performance solutions from day one.
 



  





**Role Summary** 




 We are seeking a versatile and ambitious
 **Software Development Engineer** 
 with
 **2\\+ years of professional experience** 
 to contribute to our core platform team. This role is ideal for an individual looking to accelerate their growth by working across the full stack. The successful candidate will leverage their strong foundational skills in
 **Golang and java** 
 for backend services, and
 **React JS** 
 and
 **Angular JS** 
 for front\\-end development, ensuring all code is maintainable and robust using
 **TypeScript** 
 .
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Feature Development:** 
 Implement new features and modules across the platform, focusing on both the backend service layer (Go), Java and the user interface (React/Angular).
* **Code Quality \\& Typing:** 
 Utilize
 **TypeScript** 
 consistently to ensure type safety and reduce runtime errors in both front\\-end and back\\-end application code.
* **Frontend Contribution:** 
 Contribute to the development and maintenance of reusable UI components and dashboards using
 **React JS** 
 and
 **Angular JS** 
 .
* **Backend Support:** 
 Assist in building and maintaining API endpoints and services written in
 **Go (Golang)** 
 that interact with our data pipeline.
* **Integration:** 
 Implement and test API integration logic to ensure seamless data flow between the UI, backend services, and external data sources.
* **Testing \\& Maintenance:** 
 Write unit and integration tests for new features and assist in diagnosing and resolving production bugs under the guidance of senior engineers.
* **Collaboration:** 
 Participate actively in design sessions, code reviews with product and engineering teams.



  





**Required Skills and Qualifications** 




**Experience** 



* **2\\+ years** 
 of professional experience in a Software Development or similar engineering role.
* Demonstrated ability to contribute to production\\-level code in a fast\\-paced environment.



**Core Programming Languages (Mandatory)** 



* **TypeScript:** 
 Strong working knowledge and practical experience using TypeScript for both client\\-side and server\\-side development.
* **Go (Golang):** 
 Solid foundational experience in building backend logic, APIs, or services using Go.



**Frontend Frameworks (Mandatory)** 



* **React JS:** 
 Demonstrated experience developing web applications and components using React.
* **Angular JS (or modern Angular):** 
 Practical experience contributing to Angular\\-based projects.



**Technical Skills** 



* **API Fundamentals:** 
 Good understanding of
 **RESTful APIs** 
 and how to interact with them securely.
* **Version Control:** 
 Proficiency with
 **Git** 
 for collaborative development.
* **Operating Systems:** 
 Familiarity with Linux environments and basic command\\-line tools.
* **Problem\\-Solving:** 
 Strong analytical and debugging skills with a willingness to learn complex systems quickly.



**Preferred (Bonus) Skills** 



* Understanding of data structures and algorithms commonly used in high\\-volume systems.
* Exposure to database concepts (SQL/NoSQL).
* Postgres and elasticsearch database skills
* Datacom networking skills \\- /TCPIP
* Certification courses in above must have skillsets from good training institutes



**Must Qualifications** 



* Excellent communication skills \\- written and verbal
* Remote working accountability and responsibility skills and team communication skills in a remote setting



**Educational Qualifications** 



* Btech/MCA

title: Senior Django/Python Software Engineer
description:
CapeZero (https://www.capezero.com/) is a seed\\-stage cleantech startup making an impact at the intersection of clean energy, finance, and technology. We provide renewable energy companies and investors with smarter navigation solutions for financing their solar, wind, and storage projects. We're a US\\-based mission\\-driven organization that operates at a fast pace. We value innovation, collaboration, diversity, and transparency.
   

  

 CapeZero is looking for a high\\-performing Django/Python Software Engineer to join our small team. As a backend Software Engineer, you will be responsible for building and improving our digital platform. You will work closely with financial modeling experts, other software engineers, product designers, and other stakeholders to build a robust backend system.
   

  

 At CapeZero, you'll have the opportunity to work on innovative and meaningful projects that have a positive impact on the planet.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Defining features and implementation specifications based on business requirements, working closely with the founders
* Understand the nuances of project finance and translate modeling needs to a robust backend data model and hence APIs that power the platform
* Identifying enhancements and modifications that improve product quality
* Fixing bugs, adding automated unit tests, and improving the usability/design of the APIs
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to develop, test, and maintain web\\-based software applications using Django/Python
* Design and implement data models and build on top of PostgreSQL
* Develop highly available and scalable RESTful APIs using Django Rest Framework (DRF)
* Help maintain automated testing and CI/CD pipelines using tools like GitHub Actions
* Participate in code reviews, bug triage, and provide feedback on technical designs
* Encourage a culture of continuous improvement and learning for oneself and team members


**Requirements**
* 5\\+ years of experience in software engineering, with a focus on developing web\\-based applications using Python and Django
* In\\-depth experience with Django Rest Framework (DRF)
* High proficiency in Git, Docker, and Linux systems
* Experience with front\\-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (specifically React)
* Knowledge of database design, SQL optimisation, and NoSQL databases
* Strong understanding of software testing and test\\-driven development
* Experience with modern DevOps practices, such as continuous integration, delivery, and deployment. Experience with Fly, Railway, Render, or other modern cloud platforms preferred
* Experience with Pandas and Pydantic will be handy


**Nice\\-to\\-haves:**
* Previous experience working on a B2B SaaS product
* Experience with Pydantic AI or other LLM libraries
* Knowledge of a CSS preprocessor (LESS/Sass)
* Experience with E2E QA/Testing using Cypress
* You've built something cool on your own because you enjoy doing what you do
* Open source contributions
* University degree in Computer Science or related engineering field
* Passion for renewable energy and sustainability, and the desire to make a positive impact on the world


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary
* Opportunities for domestic and international travel
* A dynamic and fast\\-paced work environment to grow in your career and make an impact
* Remote work/work from home
* Paid Time Off


 Please respond with the following
 **three important things** 
 :
   

  

* A short Cover Letter describing why this role is a good fit for you
* A link to your GitHub / relevant work we can review online
* A Resume (and LinkedIn profile if you have one)


 Also, putting the words "Django 5\\.2 is an LTS release" in your cover letter will let us know that you took the time to read this post and have good attention to detail.

title: .NET Engineer
description:
As a .NET Core Engineer, you will be responsible for developing APIs, integrating AI solutions through Python services, and coordinating with other members of the team to ensure the smooth running of our applications. You will have the opportunity to work with .NET Core, Python for AI integration, and Microsoft Azure resources, and you will be expected to contribute to collaborative problem solving and delivering a high quality product.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing\\-**
* Develop APIs using .NET Core and Azure Functions
* Build Python scripts/services for AI integrations and data processing
* Integrate AI services through Python APIs that communicate with .NET applications
* Work with Cosmos/NoSQL \\& Relational databases
* Implement vector databases and AI search functionality
* Create development, QA, demo, and production environments
* Write tests for your code
* Work as part of a cross\\-functional team to optimize API contracts, code reviews, internal infrastructure, and process enhancement
* Adapt to diverse situations and changing priorities while maintaining a positive attitude


**What We Are Looking In a Candidate\\-**
* 3\\+ years of professional experience using .NET Core
* Passion for Engineering, coding and solving problem
* Good to have react knowledge/ Typescript
* Excellent communication and team working skills
* Ability to work with small team and think outside the box
* Strong willingness to learn new technologies, especially Python for AI integration
* Basic Python knowledge or strong willingness to learn Python
* Experience with HTTP client integrations and REST API consumption
* Minimum 2 years of experience using NoSQL databases
* Experience working with Azure cloud services such as App Services, Service Bus, or curious to learn
* You can work independently
* Nice to have \\- Entity framework core, Cloud experience, AI/ML API experience

title: Custom Software Engineer
description:
**Project Role :** 
 Custom Software Engineer
   

  

**Project Role Description :** 
 Develop custom software solutions to design, code, and enhance components across systems or applications. Use modern frameworks and agile practices to deliver scalable, high\\-performing solutions tailored to specific business needs.
   

  

**Must have skills :** 
 SAP BTP Application Development
   

  

**Good to have skills :** 
 SAP FIORI/Gateway architecture,SAP UI5 Development
   

  

**Minimum 7\\.5 Year(s) Of Experience Is Required**
**Educational Qualification :** 
 15 years full time education
   

  

 , Summary: As an Application Developer, you will design, build, and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements. A typical day involves collaborating with various teams to understand their needs, developing innovative solutions, and ensuring that applications are aligned with business objectives. You will engage in problem\\-solving activities, participate in team meetings, and contribute to the overall success of projects by leveraging your expertise in application development. Roles \\& Responsibilities: \\- Expected to be an SME. \\- Collaborate and manage the team to perform. \\- Responsible for team decisions. \\- Engage with multiple teams and contribute on key decisions. \\- Provide solutions to problems for their immediate team and across multiple teams. \\- Mentor junior team members to enhance their skills and knowledge. \\- Continuously evaluate and improve application performance and user experience. Professional \\& Technical Skills: \\- Must To Have Skills: Proficiency in SAP BTP Application Development. \\- Good To Have Skills: Experience with SAP FIORI/Gateway architecture, SAP UI5 Development. \\- Strong understanding of application lifecycle management. \\- Experience with integration techniques and tools within the SAP ecosystem. \\- Familiarity with agile development methodologies. Additional Information: \\- The candidate should have minimum 7\\.5 years of experience in SAP BTP Application Development. \\- This position is based at our Pune office. \\- A 15 years full time education is required.

title: Site Reliability Engineer III - India
description:
As a Observability Engineer under Site Reliability Engineering Team, you will be a crucial part of the team responsible for the availability, performance, and scalability of our cloud platform. You will blend software engineering and systems administration expertise to build and run large\\-scale, distributed, fault\\-tolerant systems. Your mission is to ensure our services are reliable and efficient through automation, robust monitoring, and proactive incident response. You will work closely with development teams to build resilient and scalable applications on our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Kubernetes\\-based infrastructure. Having a Strong troubleshooting skills and a methodical approach to problem\\-solving is a MUST.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Design, build, and maintain our core cloud infrastructure on GCP using tools like Terraform and Google Config Connector (KCC) within a GitOps framework.
   

  

 Automation: Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Kubernetes (GKE) and Google Config Connector (KCC), Develop automation scripts and tools (primarily in Python or Go) to reduce operational toil, streamline deployments, and improve system efficiency.
   

  

 Observability: Implement and manage comprehensive monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions using tools like Prometheus, Open Telemetry, Grafana, and Google Cloud's operations suite to gain deep insights into system health.
   

  

 Reliability \\& SLOs: Define, measure, and monitor Service Level Indicators (SLIs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs) for critical services. Drive initiatives to meet and exceed these objectives. Develop \\& promote dashboarding, and actionable alerting across the organization.
   

  

 Incident Management: Participate in an on\\-call rotation to respond to and resolve production incidents. Lead blameless post\\-mortems to identify root causes and implement lasting solutions.
   

  

 Collaboration: Partner with software engineering teams throughout the development lifecycle to provide guidance on building reliable, scalable, and secure applications. Help them troubleshoot complex issues, improve service performance, and adopt observability best practices.
   

  

 Enhance Reliability: Analyze observability data to identify trends, uncover potential issues, and drive initiatives to improve system reliability, performance, and cost\\-efficiency.
   

  

 Secure and Scale: Manage secrets and system configurations securely using Hashi Corp Vault and ensure the observability platform scales to meet the demands of a growing engineering organization.
   

  

**Qualifications Required**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 3\\-8 years of experience in a Site Reliability, DevOps, or Software Engineering role.
* Strong proficiency in at least one high\\-level programming language (e.g., Python, Go, Java).
* Hands\\-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Solid understanding and practical experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or Google Config Connector.
* Familiarity with CI/CD principles and tools (e.g., GitLab CI, Jenkins...)
* Knowledge of GitOps principles and tools
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.


**CME Group: Where Futures are Made**
 CME Group is the world’s leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career by shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it – all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we’re looking for more.
   

  

 At CME Group, we embrace our employees' unique experiences and skills to ensure that everyone’s perspectives are acknowledged and valued. As an equal\\-opportunity employer, we consider all potential employees without regard to any protected characteristic.
   

  

**Important Notice:** 
 Recruitment fraud is on the rise, with scammers using misleading promises of job offers and interviews to solicit money and personal information from job seekers. CME Group adheres to established procedures designed to maintain trust, confidence and security throughout our recruitment process. Learn more here.

title: Cisco SAM Licensing Specialist
description:
**Summary** 




 We are seeking an experienced
 **Cisco SAM Licensing Specialist** 
 to lead licensing analysis, compliance, and optimization initiatives across Cisco’s broad product portfolio. This role will heavily focus on Cisco licensing—including Enterprise Agreements (EA), Product Terms interpretation, Smart Accounts, Webex, Splunk, networking software, and cloud BYOL models—while also supporting licensing activities across other major software publishers.
 



 The ideal candidate can work
 **independently in a client\\-facing role** 
 , interpret complex licensing rules, extract and analyze usage data, and deliver strategic recommendations that ensure compliance and maximize cost savings.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




**Cisco Licensing Expertise (Primary Responsibility)** 



* Serve as the
 **primary expert** 
 for Cisco licensing models, agreements, and entitlement structures.
* Manage and optimize Cisco Enterprise Agreements (EAs), including consumption tracking and renewal preparation.
* Interpret Cisco’s current and historical
 **Product Terms** 
 and translate them into actionable licensing rules.
* Support clients in managing
 **Cisco Smart Accounts** 
 , license activation, and entitlement reconciliation.
* Conduct usage and entitlement analysis for Cisco products such as
 **Webex, Splunk, security suites, networking software** 
 , and related services.
* Provide guidance on Cisco
 **BYOL models** 
 for cloud environments and associated requirements.
* Use Cisco licensing portals and tools to collect critical usage and entitlement data.
* Advise clients on Cisco renewal, negotiation strategies, and optimization opportunities.



**Software Licensing Management (Secondary Responsibility)** 



* Manage licensing and compliance for
 **multiple publishers** 
 beyond Cisco (e.g., Microsoft, Adobe, VMware, Oracle).
* Interpret license agreements, product use rights, and contract terms across various vendors.
* Ensure compliance with licensing rules and contractual obligations.
* Provide optimization recommendations and remediation actions based on usage and entitlement analysis.



**Client Engagement \\& Advisory** 



* Act as a trusted advisor in a
 **client\\-facing capacity** 
 , leading discussions, workshops, and presentations independently.
* Provide clear guidance on licensing strategy, contract structures, indirect usage scenarios, and optimization opportunities.
* Support negotiation preparation with well\\-researched insights and usage\\-based recommendations.



**Data \\& Usage Analysis** 



* Extract, validate, and analyze licensing and usage data from SAM tools (e.g.,
 **ServiceNow** 
 ,
 **Flexera** 
 ) and vendor portals.
* Conduct detailed indirect usage analysis and propose optimal licensing options.
* Build clear, data\\-driven reports that outline compliance status, usage trends, risk areas, and cost savings opportunities.



**Operational Excellence** 



* Maintain accurate inventories, documentation, and licensing records.
* Support SAM process improvement initiatives.
* Collaborate with procurement, IT, operations, and vendor management teams.



  





**Qualifications** 




**Required Qualifications** 



* **3\\+ years of hands\\-on experience with Cisco licensing** 
 , including Enterprise Agreements, Smart Accounts, and Cisco Product Terms.
* Experience across
 **multiple software publishers** 
 in a SAM or licensing role.
* Strong skills in interpreting complex licensing documentation and mapping it to real usage data.
* Client\\-facing experience with the ability to work independently.
* Proficiency using
 **ServiceNow** 
 ,
 **Flexera** 
 , or similar SAM platforms.
* Strong analytical skills with experience working with large datasets.
* Excellent communication, reporting, and stakeholder management abilities.



**Preferred Skills** 



* Experience with Cisco Webex, Splunk licensing, networking software, and security suites.
* Familiarity with Cisco’s cloud and hybrid licensing, including BYOL models.
* Exposure to contract negotiation and renewal strategies.
* Vendor licensing certifications or SAM\\-related certifications (e.g., ITIL, CSAM, CAMP).
company_industry: Information Services, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Media
